subject: Soccer
lead_paragraph: Liverpool captured the biggest victory in Champions League history yesterday, defeating the visiting Turkish club Besiktas, 8-0. Liverpool, the five-time European champion, needed a victory after gaining only a point from its first three Group A matches. Yossi Benayoun, a midfielder from Israel, scored three goals. The margin of victory was the largest since 7-0 wins by Juventus in 2003 and by Arsenal two weeks ago.The defending champion A.C. Milan; Rosenborg of Norway; Porto; Lazio; and Glasgow Celtic were also winners. Real Madrid’s match at Olympiakos and Chelsea’s match at Schalke ended in scoreless draws.
